name: robotics-mcp
description: Unified robotics control via MCP - Physical and virtual robots (bot + vbot)

config_path.title: Configuration File Path
config_path.description: Path to robotics-mcp config YAML file (optional, uses default if empty)

http_enabled.title: Enable HTTP Server
http_enabled.description: Enable HTTP API alongside stdio (default: false for Claude Desktop)

tools.name: help
tools.description: Get help information about the Robotics MCP server and its tools

tools.name: get_status
tools.description: Get robotics MCP server status with connectivity tests

tools.name: list_robots
tools.description: List all registered robots with optional filtering by type or virtual/physical status

tools.name: robot_control
tools.description: Unified robot control (works for both physical bot and virtual bot) - get status, move, stop, return to dock, stand, sit, walk, sync vbot

tools.name: virtual_robotics
tools.description: Virtual robot control (Unity/VRChat) - spawn robot, move, get status, get LiDAR, set scale, load environment, test navigation, sync with physical

tools.name: vbot_crud
tools.description: CRUD operations for virtual robots - create, read, update, delete, list vbots with support for scout, scout_e, go2, g1, robbie, and custom robot types

tools.name: robot_model_import
tools.description: Import robot 3D models (FBX/GLB/OBJ/VRM) into Unity/VRChat/Resonite - VRM only for humanoid robots (Robbie, G1), use FBX/GLB for wheeled robots (Scout)

tools.name: robot_model_export
tools.description: Export robot models from Unity to FBX/GLB/OBJ formats

tools.name: robot_model_convert
tools.description: Convert robot models between formats (FBX/GLB/OBJ/VRM) - VRM conversion only for humanoid robots

tools.name: robot_model_create
tools.description: Create robot 3D models from scratch using blender-mcp (for geometry) and gimp-mcp (for textures) - automated model creation
